articles.author: MOHAMMED JAHJOUH and FATMA KHALED
articles.description: MUWASI, Gaza Strip (AP) — On his key chain, Hassan Nofal keeps the keys to two homes. One is to the house of his grandparents in what is now southern Israel, which he says his family was driven out of by Israeli forces in 1948 and to which they’ve never been able to return.
articles.title: House keys carry symbolic weight for Gaza families repeatedly displaced by war

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — NATO leaders gathering in Washington starting Tuesday plan to shore up transatlantic support for Ukraine in its battle against Russia.
articles.title: Biden looks to make the case at the NATO summit that he is still up for the job

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Former President Donald Trump is getting back on the campaign trail Tuesday, rallying voters in his home state at his flagship golf resort in a celebratory mood as Democrats face tough calls over President Joe Biden's reelection chances.
articles.title: Trump returns to campaign trail with VP deadline nearing amid calls for Biden to withdraw

articles.author: CHRISTINE FERNANDO and AMELIA THOMSON-DEVEAUX
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A solid majority of Americans oppose a federal abortion ban as a rising number support access to abortions for any reason, a new poll finds, highlighting a politically perilous situation for candidates who oppose abortion rights as the November election draws closer.
articles.title: Support for legal abortion has risen since Supreme Court eliminated protections, AP-NORC poll finds

articles.author: TY O'NEIL, CLAIRE RUSH and ANITA SNOW
articles.description: DEATH VALLEY, Calif. (AP) — Hundreds of Europeans touring the American West and adventurers from around the U.S. are still being drawn to Death Valley National Park, even though the desolate region known as one of the Earth's hottest places is being punished by a dangerous heat wave blamed for a motorcyclist's death over the weekend.
articles.title: Tourists still flock to Death Valley amid searing US heat wave blamed for several deaths

articles.author: MARK VANCLEAVE and JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Power started to come back for some of the millions of homes and businesses left in the dark when Hurricane Beryl slammed into the Houston area, while the weakened storm moved east, spawning suspected tornadoes and causing more damage.
articles.title: Some power restored in Houston after Hurricane Beryl, while storm spawns tornadoes as it moves east

articles.author: MORGAN LEE and ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: SANTA FE, N.M. (AP) — Alec Baldwin’s trial in the shooting of a cinematographer is set to begin Tuesday with the selection of jurors who will be tasked with deciding whether the actor is guilty of involuntary manslaughter.
articles.title: Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial begins with jury selection

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS and DANICA KIRKA
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — At first glance, elections in France and Britain were a triumph for leftists and reformers over authoritarians and the right.
articles.title: Elections in Europe, Iran show authoritarian march may have slowed, not halted

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Eight years ago, Yuriko Koike became the first woman to lead Tokyo, beating her male predecessor. She won her third term as governor Sunday, and one of her closest rivals was a woman.
articles.title: Women gradually rise in Japanese politics but face deep challenges

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: Boeing will have a felony conviction if it follows through on an agreement with prosecutors to plead guilty to fraud in connection with approval of its 737 Max before two of the planes crashed, killing 346 people off the coast of Indonesia and in Ethiopia.
articles.title: Here's what to know about Boeing agreeing to plead guilty to fraud in 737 Max crashes
